body: ## Steps to Reproduce * I'm using this package https://pub.dev/packages/ansicolor * And print with this function ``` String _colorMessage(LogLevel logLevel, String message) { AnsiPen pen; switch (logLevel) { case LogLevel.error: pen = AnsiPen()..red(); break; case LogLevel.warning: pen = AnsiPen()..yellow(); break; case LogLevel.debug: pen = AnsiPen()..white(); break; case LogLevel.trace: pen = AnsiPen()..gray(level: 0.5); break; } return pen(message); } ``` * "Run" tool window * `flutter logs` ## Version info [âœ“] Flutter (Channel stable, v1.17.5, on Mac OS X 10.15.6 19G73, locale ru-RU) â€¢ Flutter version 1.17.5 at /Users/vmeretin/dev/flutter â€¢ Framework revision 8af6b2f038 (5 weeks ago), 2020-06-30 12:53:55 -0700 â€¢ Engine revision ee76268252 â€¢ Dart version 2.8.4 [âœ“] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.1) â€¢ Android SDK at /Users/vmeretin/dev/android-sdk/ â€¢ Platform android-29, build-tools 30.0.1 â€¢ ANDROID_HOME = /Users/vmeretin/dev/android-sdk/ â€¢ ANDROID_SDK_ROOT = /Users/vmeretin/dev/android-sdk/ â€¢ Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_242-release-1644-b3-6222593) â€¢ All Android licenses accepted. [âœ“] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 11.6) â€¢ Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer â€¢ Xcode 11.6, Build version 11E708 â€¢ CocoaPods version 1.9.3 [!] Android Studio (version 4.0) â€¢ Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents âœ— Flutter plugin not installed; this adds Flutter specific functionality. âœ— Dart plugin not installed; this adds Dart specific functionality. â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_242-release-1644-b3-6222593) [!] IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition (version 2020.2) â€¢ IntelliJ at /Applications/IntelliJ IDEA.app âœ— Flutter plugin not installed; this adds Flutter specific functionality. âœ— Dart plugin not installed; this adds Dart specific functionality. â€¢ For information about installing plugins, see https://flutter.dev/intellij-setup/#installing-the-plugins [âœ“] Connected device (1 available) â€¢ iPhone SE (2nd generation) â€¢ 2207B74B-0056-43BB-A0AD-6B97703D8176 â€¢ ios â€¢ com.apple.CoreSimulator.SimRuntime.iOS-13-6 (simulator)

comment_data.body:
I think this is a limitation of the core IntelliJ console (see for example, https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/360000172019-IDEA-Run-Debug-Console-not-displaying-RGB-Ansi-codes-correctly-) but maybe @alexander-doroshko knows more?

/fyi @devoncarew

@pq @devoncarew For Dart Test and Dart Command Line App run configurations, it was fixed by using `ColoredProcessHandler` instead of `OSProcessHandler`. See this commit: https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-plugins/commit/7c61483984e702013f794ce0600870267adfca09.
Fantastic.  Thanks!
Any news on this?

From looking at this, it will require changes to the Flutter plugin (minor changes, as outlined by @alexander-doroshko above), as well as changes to the flutter command line tool. Somewhere in the pipeline it looks like we're escaping the escape char (into `\^`?), so the ansi handling in the `ColoredProcessHandler` class doesn't have the right info to act on.

As part of fixing the escaping issue, we can probably also do something about the leading `flutter: ` text on print output from flutter apps.
If there are more issues about the ANSI handling, please file new issues and let me know, thanks! Before that, enjoy the colorful console. :-)
It is now working great, thanks! ðŸ‘ðŸ»
iOS has a different console IMO, so on Android it works fine currently.
@neoRiley I dont have that plugin, I just updated intellij and the flutter plugin and the console shows colors
@danielgomezrico Hey thanks for the reply - wondering if you could tell me if you're on Mac or PC and what version IntelliJ you're running?  Thanks again
@danielgomezrico also, I hate to bug you - but can you post an example of your your sending colored output to the console?

@neoRiley 
Does this work for you ` print("\x1B[38;5;${10}m Green foreground text");`

@KlausJokisuo no, this is what I see with that: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138747/109274969-b7314480-77d9-11eb-92f3-74e56aaebf5f.png)

> @KlausJokisuo no, this is what I see with that:
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138747/109274969-b7314480-77d9-11eb-92f3-74e56aaebf5f.png)

What Flutter Plugin version you have? I'm using 53.1.5
@KlausJokisuo Same 53.1.5 - Gotta be something simple, right?

> @KlausJokisuo Same 53.1.5 - Gotta be something simple, right?

@devoncarew Can this be because he/she is using Mac?
@devoncarew yes (he) I'm on Mac - Is that the issue?

Hey I appreciate everyone's help and patience, thanks very much for that.  In the end, I'm guessing being on Mac is the issue, so I went after [Grep Console](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/7125-grep-console) and that's actually working decently well.  

To anyone else coming across this on a Mac - I'm using IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate 2020.3, but I assume this works with Android Studio as well:
1.  Install Grep Console Plugin
2. In the output console, right click and choose "Grep" - this will bring up a tab that has an "Expression" field, type "flutter:" in there and hit "Apply".  You'll now see all of the flutter console logging in this new tab.  
3. Add colors to possible string values in the Grep Console Settings.  I added a ton that I use for logging in Unity.  
4. Then, to see the color, just append the string value to your print() call: `print("My test message [ORANGE]");`
 
It's the entire line and I you have to live with "[colorName]" at the end of your statements, but it does work.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138747/109383396-eadc9f00-78ab-11eb-8109-57a881e94b6d.png)
Android only ðŸ˜‚ . @neoRiley
iOS console is not following the standard console sequence. So there won't be any native colored output come out when you're running with iOS devices.

milestone.description: Issues under consideration for upcoming milestones.
milestone.title: On Deck

title: ANSI support in console
